how would you describe your main use cas: Note-taking;Journalling;As a knowledge base (including technical, non-fiction and encyclopaedic content)
do you share your tiddlywiki(s) with oth: Yes, and I am the only editor/administrator of my wiki(s)
putting it all together, what value does: I like that it can be very simple to use, but I have the option to "go deep" when needed. It's a local-first, single-file HTML document, which is a winning combination.
what is your level of ability with tiddl: I have customised TiddlyWiki through options and plugins;I am comfortable using WikiText widgets (e.g. <$transclude>, <$list>...);I am comfortable writing filter expressions;I have written custom HTML;I have written custom CSS styles
how do you save changes in tiddlywiki?: Single-file wiki with custom saver (e.g. TiddlyPWA, Timimi, tw5-browser-nativesaver)

what are we doing well? prompts for thin: Consistent steady improvement with sensible introduction of new features.
what could we do better? prompts for thi: Documentation. There is a lot of it, but much of it isn't helpful. For example, the notes about a feature dive directly into every possible scenario/option. Would prefer you pick a few common use cases and start there. Not easy, I know.
with your consent, we would like to publ: Yes, I am happy for my responses to be published
